comments:
Build: 2.1 RC1

1) Open a brand new workspace
2) Switch to java perspective
3) Select Run > Run As > Runtime workbench

An error dialog pops up:

"Launch failed. Plugin "org.eclipse.core.boot" is missing or does not contain
"boot.jar" library (if in workspace, check that boot.jar is on the project's
classpath).

In the log, there's an ERROR logged, and a stack trace.  This is a harsh failure
mode for a simple user mistake.  The log file should only be used for internal
errors and programming errors, not user mistakes.  Here is the stack in the log:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Launching failed. Plugin
"org.eclipse.core.boot" is missing or does not contain "boot.jar" library (if in
workspace, check that boot.jar is on the project's classpath).
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.validatePlugins(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:448)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.createWorkspaceRunnerConfiguration(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:180)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:74)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:668)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch(DebugUITools.java:537)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$2.run(DebugUITools.java:486)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:95)

Fixed.
Nothing is written to the .log file if plug-in "org.eclipse.core.boot" is 
missing.
Error dialog also now shows a better message.

traces.message: Launching failed. Plugin "org.eclipse.core.boot" is missing or does not contain "boot.jar" library (if in workspace, check that boot.jar is on the project's classpath).
